case_vignette: A 54-year-old man comes to the physician for the evaluation of difficulty swallowing of both solids and liquids for 1 month! During the past 5 months, he has also had increased weakness of his hands and legs! He sails regularly and is unable to hold the ropes as tightly as before! Ten years ago, he was involved in a motor vehicle collision! Examination shows atrophy of the tongue! Muscle strength is decreased in the right upper and lower extremities! There is muscle stiffness in the left lower extremity! Deep tendon reflexes are 1+ in the right upper and lower extremities, 3+ in the left upper extremity, and 4+ in the left lower extremity! Plantar reflex shows an extensor response on the left foot! Sensation to light touch, pinprick, and vibration is intact!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having difficulty swallowing both solids and liquids for about a month, and I've also noticed increased weakness in my hands and legs over the past five months.
Do you have any history of neurological disorders in your family?
No, I don't have any family history of neurological disorders.
Have you experienced changes in your voice or any problems with your speech recently?
No, I haven't experienced any changes in my voice or problems with my speech.
Have you lost any weight recently without trying?
No, I have not lost any weight recently without trying.
Do you have any other symptoms, such as double vision, drooping eyelids, or difficulty breathing?
No, I do not have double vision, drooping eyelids, or difficulty breathing.
Have you seen a doctor, and if so, have you undergone any tests or received any preliminary diagnoses?
Yes, I have seen a physician for an evaluation recently.
What were the results of the evaluation or any tests you might have had?
The evaluation showed that I have muscle weakness and stiffness in my limbs, and my tongue has atrophied.
Final Diagnosis: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)
